column1: Today is Public Health Thank You Day!  I want to thank the millions of medical professionals who risk their lives every day to save American lives nationwide.  They are the true heroes of the coronavirus pandemic! https://t.co/G0ctBR1am1

If you need a coronavirus test visit the website below.  There are 400 testing sites located across the state and our 10th District available to serve you.  https://t.co/f2TXP4yznU https://t.co/rV5QARmqCN

Today more than 250000 Americans have died from this coronavirus.          I introduced a resolution today to declare January 21st 2021 a National Day of Mourning for these Americans souls.  We need to come together as a nation to acknowledge them and honor their passing. https://t.co/93zu62zo19
Nero fiddled while Rome burned.  Trump golfs while Americans die.  Trump's response to the coronavirus public health crisis has been and continues to be a national disgrace! https://t.co/snFEBQ8lOL

The deadline for states to use CARES Act funding is about to run out.  With coronavirus cases rising nationwide I wrote a letter with 10 of my NJ colleagues to give New Jersey and the country more time to use that money.    Read the letter here:  https://t.co/1KUY6QU5PH https://t.co/5XDXkHyJap

Rutgers New Jersey Medical School will be hosting two FREE COVID-19 testing events this Saturday (11/14) and next Saturday (11/21) from 12 - 4 pm at 140 Bergen Street in Newark.    These events are open to all.  For more information call (973) 820-3397. https://t.co/EpMEo4lGAG

CONGRATULATIONS TO RUTGERS!!  It received a $5 million grant from the National Institutes of Health to expand access to coronavirus testing for underserved and vulnerable populations. https://t.co/hStRJHjzjC
GREAT NEWS for NEW JERSEY!!  FEMA has awarded $1.6 million to the New Jersey Department of Health and Senior Services as reimbursement for coronavirus-related costs. https://t.co/FjDwfrb3WZ

I enjoyed my time with the Bayonne City Council last night.  I wanted to give them an update on coronavirus stimulus legislation and what Bayonne would receive in aid if the revised Heroes Act is passed. https://t.co/GmY2V29uW4

Since Trump and Senate Republicans don't support COVID-19 relief millions of Americans face evictions this month.  If you’re having trouble paying rent you may qualify for eviction protection.    Visit https://t.co/CBMjsEzyFf for more information. #KnowYourRights https://t.co/XLjT9IRhwP

The airline industry has been crippled from the coronavirus.   Airline executives have said thousands could be laid off soon without help.  I wrote a letter to Pres. Trump today to ask him to support more aid for airline workers.  We must protect this crucial industry! https://t.co/JP4y3HCDSi

The coronavirus is a physical and mental health issue.  It's important to take care of your mental health whether you have a mental health condition or not.   If someone you love is struggling with mental health issues please reach out and let them know that they are #NotAlone. https://t.co/XZc4sYzOLx

Today is World Teacher Day!  We must celebrate and honor our teachers nationwide for the work they are doing online and in classrooms to educate our students during this coronavirus global pandemic. https://t.co/FHYURLEyzD

President Trump has been flown to Walter Reed Medical Center for coronavirus care but we don't know why.      Dr. Sean Conley the President's doctor needs to come before the American people and give us the truth on POTUS condition! https://t.co/FsgbQIaqgK

Like many of you I heard Pres. Trump has the coronavirus.  It's a contagious and deadly disease I wouldn't want anyone to get.  Hopefully all Americans will understand it's a very real public health threat.  Please wear masks in public.  Protect yourself and stay safe! https://t.co/mhfKdZyiLX

I am concerned about seniors and their ability to get critical medicine and medical care during the coronavirus.  I wrote a letter to the leadership of two House committees today to support more funding for technology to help them get them online. https://t.co/6FCArguE2o

While coronavirus continues to assault the nation let's not forget that too many Americans are still dying from gun violence.  This year  there have been more than 12000 deaths and 425 mass shootings.  We need to pass H.R. 8 to prevent these deaths.  #WearOrangeMasks https://t.co/fIMCIBrSkK

A study found that 9 million children struggle to get enough food because their parents are one of the 35 million people unemployed due to the coronavirus.    We passed the #HeroesAct to help these Americans survive!  This should not happen in America! https://t.co/FQioSI2KCe

The U.S. death toll from coronavirus has officially topped 200000.      My prayers and condolences go out to everyone who has lost a family member or friend to this global pandemic.  Please wear masks so we can lower the infections and deaths from this disease. https://t.co/eI98PbjBqv

This week is #SmallBusinessWeek !    I've visited several small businesses in our district to see how they are handling the economic struggles from the coronavirus.  I want to celebrate them and all the Main Street businesses of  New Jersey's 10th district that fuel our economy. https://t.co/c0Ke8jbyHS

The Trump Administration just called coronavirus masks an "operating expense" so they could stop reimbursing schools for mask purchases.  I introduced a bill today to continue reimbursements for masks so students and workers can be safe during in-school learning. https://t.co/sS2af2v8Bn

Today is #NationalPollWorkerRecruitmentDay!   There is a significant shortage of poll workers in our state and across the country due to the coronavirus.  If you are able please sign up to be a poll worker on November 3rd.  Visit https://t.co/DzQaP9GJam https://t.co/jLx2R7i0Mp
It’s up to us to #MaskUp and stop the spread of #COVID19.   Join me and my NJ colleagues.  Wear your mask in public and keep our communities safe! #MaskUpNewJersey https://t.co/OkNNahhuTe

We approved $75 billion for coronavirus testing tracing and treatment in the Heroes Act.  Yet it collects dust on Mitch McConnell’s desk.  The Senate must pass the #HeroesAct immediately so we can test effectively and reopen schools and society without any reservations! https://t.co/Kn0TDV88FB

Too many businesses are using the coronavirus as an excuse to reject American currency.  This needs to stop immediately!    I wrote a letter to House and Senate leadership today to ask them to protect cash as a payment choice during this global pandemic. https://t.co/YWPURFSHF9

GREAT NEWS FOR THE POST OFFICE!  Postmaster General DeJoy said he will pause the operational changes that have slowed mail delivery during the coronavirus.   Let's hope this improves mail service across the district and country. https://t.co/wAecE77pjN

One day we are going to beat the coronavirus.  When we do I want to make sure the treatments and cures are affordable and accessible for all Americans.  I wrote a letter today to the bipartisan leadership of three House Committees to highlight this fact. https://t.co/mNy7WvpL9H

The coronavirus in America today.  ➡️5000000 cases.  ➡️160000 dead.  ➡️55 million first-time unemployment claims.  Yet Republicans refuse more unemployment benefits.  They keep the economy going and DON'T discourage people from working.  Republicans need to act NOW!! https://t.co/5UDFA4Ht72

Great News for Essex County!  FEMA awarded the county almost $1.8 million to pay for coronavirus-related expenses.  We need to help our state and local municipalities as much as possible during this global pandemic. https://t.co/4jBkVnTSua

I am extremely upset that the coronavirus is more deadly in our communities of color.  Right now my Subcommittee on Emergency Preparedness Response & Recovery to discussing why.  Listen to my opening remarks and then join me at https://t.co/XFm6AVYoGv to watch the hearing. https://t.co/3knZpWjJml

Join me right now to find out why the coronavirus is more deadly to communities of color than white communities.    We will hear expert testimony about the issue during my Subcommittee on Emergency Preparedness Response & Recovery hearing.  Visit https://t.co/XFm6AVYoGv. https://t.co/1zmQxZkf4J

The coronavirus is more deadly to communities of color than white communities and I want to find out why.  Join me at 12:00 p.m. on Friday to hear expert testimony about the causes during my Subcommittee hearing at https://t.co/XFm6AVYoGv. https://t.co/IkR5nDxKgb

The Economic Development Administration has awarded Rutgers University for $300000 from CARES Act funding.  It's well deserved!  Rutgers has been key to efforts to combat the coronavirus from the very beginning such the school's at-home saliva test kit for the disease. https://t.co/ed3MwIAp2a

The coronavirus is far more deadly in communities of color so I convened a hearing of the Subcommittee on Emergency Preparedness Response & Recovery to find out why.  As chairman of this crucial subcommittee we need to do more to save Americans nationwide. https://t.co/04Hy4LgbBf

RENTAL ASSISTANCE LOTTERY FOR NJ RESIDENTS!!  Today is the first day to apply for the lottery to get temporary rental assistance for low- and moderate-income households that have lost income or a job due to the COVID-19 pandemic.  To apply visit https://t.co/oFCe4RSo2f https://t.co/pv6V1C5Tlf

RENTAL ASSISTANCE LOTTERY FOR NJ RESIDENTS!!  The COVID-19 ERAP will provide temporary rental assistance to low- and moderate-income renters who have lost income or a job during this crisis.    For more information on how to enter the lottery visit https://t.co/oFCe4RSo2f https://t.co/1L9na154Z0

Pres. Trump may think he can ignore COVID-19 but Americans know we can’t. Millions are unemployed more than 120000 have lost their lives and cases are climbing. It’s time for the Senate to take action & pass the #HeroesAct! https://t.co/o1KPlRKGSp

Last night I voted to get renters and homeowners relief to survive this coronavirus crisis.  We need to stop this public health and economic crisis from becoming a housing and eviction crisis.    Also I voted to give Americans more control of their credit score. https://t.co/dELKXC3WUI

I enjoyed my time with the great people of the I Have A Dream Foundation and The Vanguard restaurant today.  We spent the afternoon preparing food for 100 families who have suffered during this coronavirus crisis.  Everyone should find a safe way to volunteer in your town. https://t.co/x6yZclJJGB

Today I co-sponsored the COVID-19 Homeowner Assistance Fund Act.  The bill would provide financial assistance to homeowners to pay for mortgages property taxes and even utilities to avoid foreclosure.  We can't let a public health and economic crisis become a housing crisis. https://t.co/hcmCc5t3bZ

Thrilled to announce that our district (NJ-10) has been awarded more than $15 million in grants from the U.S. Dept. of Housing and Urban Development to keep people from becoming homeless during this coronavirus crisis. https://t.co/rESgPc8XT6

WARNING FOR NEW JERSEY RESIDENTS!!  The IRS has said to be on the lookout for scams related to COVID-19 stimulus money and other issues.  If you have been the victim of a scam or an attempted scam please report it at https://t.co/8tLQ7nhuFN https://t.co/8znt9OW35l

I had a great time visiting with my constituents in West Orange tonight.  I wanted them to hear about what we are doing to combat racial profiling eliminate police brutality and help our small businesses during this coronavirus crisis. https://t.co/lo8ooGPmU5

The NJEDA today announced that applications for the expanded Small Business Emergency Assistance Grant Program will be available at 9:00 a.m. on June 9 2020.    If you need a grant up to $10000 to help with coronavirus expenses please visit https://t.co/4FRIudrwzT. https://t.co/DaA5sc2Jbj

The New Jersey Economic Development Authority (NJEDA) has announced Phase 2 of coronavirus aid to state small businesses.  Now more businesses are eligible for funding such as sole-proprietorships and home-based businesses.  For more information visit https://t.co/4FRIudJ7rr https://t.co/7I6aWwvVYB

I was proud to vote today to give small businesses more flexibility with their coronavirus stimulus loans and grants.   Now we need to pass the Heroes Act to get critical aid to state and local governments. #FamiliesFirst  #HeroesAct https://t.co/v6eTR66EXg
Join me right now for a discussion of COVID-19's effect on New Jersey and Louisiana with my honorable colleague Rep. Cedric Richmond and a panel of distinguished guests. https://t.co/utRU8NWZVA

May is National Cancer Research Month.  We have seen the vital importance of research in how we find cures to disease during this coronavirus global pandemic.  We must always remember the doctors and scientists who work to keep us safe throughout the year. https://t.co/zsfeabM5k1
Join me today as I discuss COVID-19's effect on New Jersey and Louisiana with my honorable colleague Rep. Cedric Richmond and a panel of distinguished guests. https://t.co/nqQBZaWJvG

Rutgers University is holding a COVID-19 community discussion later today from 6:00 p.m. – 7:00 p.m.    The panel of health professionals will focus on the importance of testing prevention and control measures and recent developments.  I would recommend everyone tune in. https://t.co/iSG432rDGn

The only way we are going to get back to normal is increased testing for coronavirus.  I wrote a letter with support from the entire NJ Congressional delegation to ask FEMA to continue funding our state's two federal testing centers and help us get to 25000 tests per day. https://t.co/KJgR9xHspv

Last week I wrote a  letter to United Airlines about their failure to give refunds to customers who had to cancel travel plans due to the coronavirus.  They seem more open to refunds now but let me know if you have any issues when you apply.  Visit https://t.co/bfo58rAO0E. https://t.co/nk9N1jlw7i

HOUSING HELP FOR NEWARK RESIDENTS!  The city launched a COVID-19 Tenant Based Rental Assistance Program to help residents pay their housing costs during this global pandemic.    For more information visit https://t.co/vdHrq5ZtbT https://t.co/5151Lzp54E

If you are worried about losing your home during this public health crisis watch "Know Your Rights: A Virtual Town Hall on Eviction and Foreclosure Rights During the COVID-19 Pandemic."  It is today an hour from now at 1 p.m.  Tune in at https://t.co/eLzWuszThZ https://t.co/PJTjVXdGwh

After I received constituent calls and posts about how airlines have refused to refund money for trips cancelled due to coronavirus I wrote a letter to four major airlines and United in particular to urge them to spend our stimulus money on customers and workers. https://t.co/SwqTXRj6xK

Sorry to hear of the passing of "Mr. Glen Ridge" - Charles "Rob" Roberts.  The 20-year police veteran  died yesterday from coronavirus.    My condolences to his family the Glen Ridge police department and the entire city of Glen Ridge for their tremendous loss. https://t.co/0EovfLfcIW

Congratulations to Rutgers University!!!!   The Food and Drug Administration authorized a coronavirus test developed at the school that will allow people to collect their own saliva at home and send to a lab for results.  Great work from a great university! https://t.co/WV0eXgOmag

It's National Nurses Appreciation Week and Month!     They are the heroes of this coronavirus crisis and we can't celebrate them enough.  Search for a local nurses organization and ask how you can show your appreciation for their life-saving work during this tragic time. https://t.co/HxFFwzKffQ

It's Teacher Appreciation Week and a great time to honor the educators in your community.   Contact your local PTA and learn about ways to praise them during this coronavirus crisis. https://t.co/4vD9TTrzf4

CORONAVIRUS TESTING FOR ALL NEWARK RESIDENTS!!!!  Testing will start Wednesday May 6 from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. at the Branch Brook Park Roller Skating Rink.     Testing is by APPOINTMENT ONLY.  For an appointment please call (973) 988-5511 to see if you are eligible. https://t.co/fvLS4oqe0U

It's Teacher Appreciation Week and a great time to honor the educators in your community.  They are finding creative ways to teach our children remotely during this coronavirus crisis. https://t.co/euDOah372C

Glad to hear the Dept. of Health and Human Services allocated $1.7 billion to New Jersey health providers for COVID-19 patient care and $138 million for low-income/ uninsured care.  Our health care heroes deserve all the resources we can get them during this coronavirus crisis. https://t.co/xBkt4KcvUQ

As a nation we owe a tremendous debt to our frontline and essential workers.  But I want to do more than thank them.   I introduced a bill today to give them hazard pay for their work during this coronavirus crisis.  We need to show them how much they matter. https://t.co/VGPIopCyTD

Please join me and Rep. Max Rose (D-NY) right now as we discuss the coronavirus crisis with Ron Klain former White House Ebola Response Coordinator.  You can view it at https://t.co/bZM5nKOt3y or on YouTube at https://t.co/bm0REQGd9T https://t.co/2YNcbpdjDM

Please join me and Rep. Max Rose (D-NY) today when we discuss how we are battling the coronavirus with Ron Klain former White House Ebola Response Coordinator.    You can view it at https://t.co/bZM5nKOt3y or on YouTube at https://t.co/bm0REQGd9T https://t.co/fj2xWo6fHM

CORONAVIRUS FEMA FORUM HAPPENING NOW!!  Please join me and Rep. Val Demings (D-FL) today when we discuss the coronavirus crisis with W. Craig Fugate former FEMA administrator.  You can view it at https://t.co/bZM5nKOt3y or on YouTube at https://t.co/0XuSpTAryp https://t.co/r9uVmLxFzt

Please join me and Rep. Val Demings (D-FL) today when we discuss what FEMA is doing to battle the coronavirus with W. Craig Fugate former FEMA administrator.  You can view it at https://t.co/bZM5nKOt3y or on YouTube at https://t.co/0XuSpTAryp https://t.co/bsloB829rx

Please join me and Rep. Val Demings (D-FL) tomorrow when we discuss how we are battling the coronavirus with W. Craig Fugate former FEMA administrator.    You can view it at https://t.co/bZM5nKOt3y or on YouTube at https://t.co/0XuSpTAryp https://t.co/r6nN8JfGBb

Essex County announced today that COVID-19 Testing Site in Weequahic Park is now open to all Essex County residents.    If you are a resident and interested in getting tested please visit https://t.co/IhZH0GphiB or call 973-324-9950. https://t.co/WxjbZVbQCG

CORONAVIRUS REIMBURSEMENT FOR UNINSURED PATIENT CARE!!  The Dept. of Health and Human Services has a web portal for hospitals and medical facilities to apply for CARES Act reimbursement for uninsured patient care.    Apply now at https://t.co/EwZnKNrqaz https://t.co/YVHJCnZQ1P

Today I voted for the 4th Coronavirus stimulus bill.  It will provide $310 billion to the Paycheck Protection Program $75 billion to support health care facilities and $25 billion to improve the nation's testing.   All things we need desperately! https://t.co/QxQWr7zywl

I'm proud to support our 4th Coronavirus Relief Package but we have to get this money to the small businesses that need it the most!    We can't have million-dollar companies getting money while smaller ones can't get a dime.  I spoke about it on the House floor today. https://t.co/N0VtVSe6Ph

Ramadan Mubarak!  During this year's #Ramadan let us remember that the values celebrated this month- hope compassion and community- are the same values that will help us survive this coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/fL5AYZF746

VOICE YOUR CORONAVIRUS UNEMPLOYMENT COMPLAINTS!!  The NJ Department of Labor has set up a web portal to deal with resident complaints during this coronavirus crisis.    Go to to https://t.co/tAm1fGrdZk - Scroll to the right for “Need Help” and follow the instructions. https://t.co/zVuBdQUyZp

Domestic violence has increased dramatically during stay-at-home orders worldwide.  We need to get victims of abuse the support they need.  I wrote to House leadership today to request $20 million for Family Justice centers nationwide in the next coronavirus stimulus package. https://t.co/sJpcHyMTet

Our battle with COVID-19 shows the importance of providing medical resources to our first responders and health care workers.   An accurate census count helps them get those resources.  FIll it out at https://t.co/oz5RDENWsL. #FirstResponders #HealthCareWorkers #NJCensus2020 https://t.co/UIZczXUyXV

Our essential workers have been there for us to provide food medicine and services to help us survive this coronavirus crisis.  Now we need to be there for them.  I will fight to get them money for their service and their protection such as PPEs. #Covid19  #ProtectAllWorkers https://t.co/RQte6d8jLP

There was a good article in the NY Times this weekend about the need to care for dialysis patients during the coronavirus crisis.  I wrote a letter to Speaker Pelosi and House Minority Leader McCarthy last week to do that in the next stimulus bill.  https://t.co/RcQBsey7z2

FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE HELP!!  I join Newark Mayor Baraka's Coronavirus Update today to discuss how residents can get help with stimulus checks unemployment benefits small business loans and other issues.    Watch it today at 5 p.m. at https://t.co/pIuKtbjZ2W https://t.co/O5a9gzttgG

GOOD NEWS FOR NEW JERSEY!!  FEMA just awarded our state more than $21 million to fight the coronavirus.  But the award is only 75% of what the state needs.  I'm fighting to get NJ the other $7 million and more in other stimulus packages. https://t.co/tTIKvgf8nn

Our small businesses are suffering and crippling our economy.  We need to do all we can to help them survive this public health and economic crisis.  #FamiliesFirst #COVID19 #Smallbiz #SmallBizRelief https://t.co/bQk3kQw8Eb

CONGRATULATIONS to RUTGERS!!  Researchers at @RutgersU just received FDA approval for a new coronavirus test that uses saliva.  It will speed up testing and make it safer for our nation's medical professionals  Great work from a great university. https://t.co/tWTDZD6Hc3

STIMULUS PAYMENT INFORMATION!!  Some residents have received their stimulus payments already.  If you want help with your stimulus payment please visit the Coronavirus Emergency Resource page on my website.  https://t.co/X7zH0M40lk https://t.co/jME3zHnhGM
JOB OPENINGS...  The Small Business Administration needs workers to handle coronavirus-related needs.  Feel free to apply below.    https://t.co/ouT3q700Wj https://t.co/8qDV9JYduz

Everyday another group of heroes emerges from this coronavirus global pandemic.    I want to praise the men and women of the Newark YMCA and all the others across the country.  They are risking their lives to take care of our homeless residents during this difficult time. https://t.co/sHgOFFDfAs

ELECTRIC AND GAS SHUT-OFF SUSPENSION...  PSE&G has suspended electric and gas shut-offs due to the COVID-19 outbreak. New Jersey customers experiencing financial difficulty should MyAccount (https://t.co/lnG7FqkoAJ) or call 1-800-430-4370 to make a deferred payment arrangement. https://t.co/1MWnjN3JlH

STIMULUS PAYMENTS FOR NON-TAX FILERS:  Taxpayers who aren’t required to file annual returns have a portal to submit information needed to receive coronavirus economic impact statements.  The direct deposit portal will be running soon.    Here’s the link. https://t.co/tS51FwuYqQ https://t.co/zCTLFWzIVA

Diabetics and others who need dialysis treatments are a high risk for coronavirus infections  I wrote a letter to FEMA and the HHS to make sure dialysis patients and clinicians get the medical supplies they need to stay safe during this public health crisis.

Join @TheBlackCaucus for a telephone town hall with national Black leaders on the impact of the coronavirus on Black communities accessing the resources of the CARES Act and next steps.   Registration required: https://t.co/lJs39IUssB

@BajekEdward First check my Coronavirus Resources page on my website- https://t.co/X7zH0M40lk.  It has information on how to contact the agencies that can help.  If that doesn't work feel free to call my office at (973) 645-3213 and give us more details.  Thanks for letting me know.

UNION COUNTY SMALL BUSINESS OWNERS!  Your local leaders are holding a forum on Wednesday April 8th to help you learn how you can get support during this coronavirus crisis.   Contact your State Senator for more information or watch the forum here.   https://t.co/ks32FHPXf6 https://t.co/u11vcKvWq4

While we social distance it is the brave men and women of our U.S. mail and other delivery companies who are handling our survival needs.  I want to thank every one of them for their incredible work to supply us during this difficult time.    #USPS #FedEx #UPS #DHL #delivery https://t.co/cpML9Cxo2w

I was absolutely delighted to hear that Majority Whip Jim Clyburn will chair the panel to oversee the more than $2 trillion from the coronavirus stimulus fund.    He is a man of incredible integrity who will make sure that money is spent wisely and effectively. https://t.co/TptbLjI30d

SCAM WARNING!  Even with thousands of Americans sick and dying of coronavirus and thousands more losing their jobs there are still horrible people trying to scam Americans out of their stimulus checks.  Please visit the website below and be ready.  https://t.co/JdBJObby3f

I was sad to hear of the passing Tuesday of a medical hero Dr. Frank Gabrin due to #covid19.   Dr. Gabrin worked to treat patients at East Orange General Hospital despite the risks.   We owe him and all our medical heroes a tremendous debt during this crisis. #stayhomestaysafe https://t.co/rqGLKd2U1o

NJ GETS MORE MONEY!!!!  The Federal Transit Administration (FTA) said New Jersey will get almost $1.8 billion to help the state's transit industry more than the projected $1.25 billion.  It's great news and will help maintain our infrastructure during this coronavirus crisis. https://t.co/NMnjcGVLAr

Rutgers will graduate 192 qualified medical students early and Gov. Murphy will reactivate retired doctors and nurses to help combat coronavirus statewide.     I'm delighted because our medical heroes need all the help they can get right now.   @RU.NJMS @governorphilmurphy https://t.co/dyNAE4vMYt

CORONAVIRUS SUPPORT UPDATE: Small Businesses can begin to apply for stimulus help tomorrow April 3rd and direct deposits of stimulus checks begin in two weeks.  Mailed checks will begin May 1.    Find more info at https://t.co/X7zH0M40lk and https://t.co/TGcYcZ7gyh https://t.co/u5hyLq54Dp

CORONAVIRUS UPDATE:  Proud to hear the VA Medical Facility in East Orange will make its excess space available to coronavirus patients and they will do it in a way that won't threaten the veterans there with infection.   @VeteransAffairs https://t.co/vaL6J1h1vO

CORONAVIRUS INFO UPDATE:  If you want to contact the Governor's office for any reason during this coronavirus crisis contact the Office of Constituent Relations at Constituent.Relations@nj.gov.    It's far more effective than a phone call. Please pass it on. https://t.co/Z3PQP7S61Z

I am absolutely FURIOUS at how Trump has handled our coronavirus crisis.  Now he wants to delay desperately needed payment checks until he can sign his name to the bottom.  People are dying from this disease!!  We need leadership now!!    #DeposittThePeoplesMoneyNOW https://t.co/4lyPO7GeIc

CORONAVIRUS INFORMATION RESOURCE:  If want to know about testing locations unemployment benefits small business assistance or state orders to combat this disease please visit my website:  https://t.co/AbhjA2O8sG  Please send this message to ALL your neighbors in NJ-10. https://t.co/0dbL4EaGXt

CORONAVIRUS UPDATE:  The President declared New Jersey a Major Disaster which allows the state to access more federal resources for emergency work and even crisis counseling.   For more information on New Jersey's coronavirus actions visit https://t.co/ClpOrCc5dO https://t.co/hqewPjq8tX

ESSEX COUNTY has a CORONAVIRUS TESTING FACILITY IN Weequahic Park!!!!   For residents please visit https://t.co/IhZH0GphiB.  You will be screened for symptoms online before an appointment is scheduled.  Then you will receive a confirmation number to bring to your appointment. https://t.co/MqpO77vhX5

FOOD and CASH ASSISTANCE for NJ RESIDENTS:  If you need of food or cash assistance during this coronavirus crisis New Jersey has a website to apply for help:    https://t.co/JKEf7pfi3R https://t.co/EQAXvgpN89

EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES:   NJ Gov. Murphy launched a jobs portal to help residents during the coronavirus crisis.  It is available here: https://t.co/K3kdY5usXY.   Companies should submit information about urgent hiring needs here: https://t.co/sNSY1Xpolu. https://t.co/U9mbJ2P5Ie

Today my New Jersey colleagues and I wrote a letter to ask Pres. Trump to declare New Jersey a Major Disaster area to free up more federal funds to combat coronavirus.    Cases in NY are increasing daily.  We need more funding to protect state and district residents. https://t.co/80QZYJqHJi

It has been 10 years since the Affordable Care Act (or Obamacare) was signed into law.    As we battle the coronavirus global pandemic I'm glad and relieved that so many Americans have medical insurance. #ProtectOurCare #ForThePeople https://t.co/sZmN3YeFzu

CORONAVIRUS UPDATE:  New Jersey has a website dedicated to coronavirus information.  It is https://t.co/ClpOrCc5dO   Please visit it to get the latest number of cases statewide as well as recent restrictions. https://t.co/CwlSEBrbgO

CORONAVIRUS UPDATE:  UNION COUNTY opened the first drive-through testing facility for the disease. @countyofunionnj   But don't rush out until you get an APPOINTMENT that can only be made at your DOCTOR'S OFFICE.  So see your health care specialist immediately if you need one. https://t.co/9qj5Tnhd4S

Today I co-signed a letter to the State Department to ask them to work with government agencies foreign governments and commercial airlines to help Americans home who are abroad. two letters related to our coronavirus public health crisis. https://t.co/8dqZfTOXXx

As the coronavirus continues to cause stress and anxiety nationwide I want to take a moment to thank America's health care workers.  They are putting their lives at risk every day to heal the sick and keep us safe.  I want to thank all of them for their dedication and care. https://t.co/CwbO0rFN0r

I am looking for every way possible to restrict the spread of coronavirus in New Jersey.    I co-signed a letter to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement to work harder to prevent disease after an employee at a detention facility in Elizabeth NJ tested positive for it. https://t.co/6WhPkHq8lR
